TopicTitle: [1.1.2] KSPRC - Renaissance Compilation: artworks remake [V-0.7 Pre Release 3]

Articles.Content:
I just noticed... You have no clouds on your KSP?

Of course not. Proot creates the clouds!

I love how much the case sticks out. Hope you have a beefy long GFX card in there. Initially when I put my HD7870 into my case I could no longer slide the motherboard tray all the way in haha. Eventually I managed to wrangle cables around to give me the extra inch to get it closed and screwed down

Edited September 8, 2015 by Gaiiden

I'm using the WIP-EVE, which for the moment don't have clouds at the title screen.

...buuuut that allows me to see better the new texture for Kerbin.

Oh my..

Looking VERY nice Proot welcome back.

Oh. My. God... It's beautiful...

Edited September 10, 2015 by Avera9eJoe

I'm using the WIP-EVE, which for the moment don't have clouds at the title screen.

...buuuut that allows me to see better the new texture for Kerbin.

http://i.imgur.com/B40jcAe.jpg

Proot, that looks awfully scary. I hope you will be providing 4K, 2K, and 1K versions for those of use who like to have an atmosphere along with mods.
Mein gott. Also very cool setup!
OMG I can't wait for this! Is there a mailing list or something so I could notified when it's released?
Nice to see you Proot glad our donations helped you out and thanks for the pic of the new PC

Hey, Proot, it looks like we use the same HOTAS, at least until I can save up $400 for the Thrustmaster Warthog.

Honestly, though, the Warthog would be almost useless for KSP until someone figures out a way to adjust RPM switches with it's toggle switches.

I'm using the WIP-EVE, which for the moment don't have clouds at the title screen.

...buuuut that allows me to see better the new texture for Kerbin.

http://i.imgur.com/B40jcAe.jpg

That is friggin' impressive!
Welcome back Proot. Looking forward for more info and release date

Welcome back Proot. Looking forward for more info and release date

Why ya gotta do?...
I think perhaps Jovzin meant "looking forward to the day of release" or similar.

Lol it's all good my apologies. But regardless...im on the prowl.

Beware.
holy .... dude that is ....ing gorgeous
Wake me when it's here.

Im getting black headed kerbals in the VAB (no racism LOL, the texture is missing).

And much of the ground clutter, grass etc is black.

Using ATM and this pack with EVE.

Any ideas? Cheers

Im getting black headed kerbals in the VAB (no racism LOL, the texture is missing).

And much of the ground clutter, grass etc is black.

Using ATM and this pack with EVE.

Any ideas? Cheers

... o-O odd... Could you try removing the custom kerbal heads and see if it removes the problem too? Just a double check to make sure it's a texture issue, not a 'fix'. Someone else has been mentioning having problems with custom kerbal textures with the most recent TextureReplacer release. My guess is it's related to that (Again though I'm just guessing).

EDIT: I relayed this over to TextureReplacer and it appears as though Shaw posted a new test TextureReplacer.dll.

Edited September 14, 2015 by Avera9eJoe
Ok, last time I tried to use this, it broke my game...Most likely because I was using it in 1.0.4... Could not even click on any of the KSC parts
That was cause you installed the sharedasset in KSPRC for 0.90. In 1.0.4 the sunflare doesn't work.

That was cause you installed the sharedasset in KSPRC for 0.90. In 1.0.4 the sunflare doesn't work.

Did you install just the textures and config files? You will have to install EVE, Planetshine, Distant Object, and Texture Replacer manually because the ones that come with the KSPRC pack are very outdated and don't work.
Black heads fixed by removing the standard kerbal head retextures in TextureReplacer

The next version is mainly waiting for the multiplanet capability in "Scatterer" mod. Some image previews.

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Hey can't wait for this to be updated! I installed this earlier this weekend and it broke my game, so it was uninstalled. But, i loved hpw kerbin looked.

The next version is mainly waiting for the multiplanet capability in "Scatterer" mod. Some image previews.

http://imgur.com/a/oitq7

Well here is to hoping mac gets 64bit capabilities in 1.1. Truly extraordinary proot.
